Through his dedication to the trade, he earned very good profits that enabled him support and help his family.  He is a hardworking person who strives to succeed.  He is requesting this loan to purchase blankets, hammocks, and other general items for the business.  He has many orders because he works with other “macateros” in the area that bring him their products to sell in various parts of the country.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras están trabajando con muchas ganas, ya que quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. El grupo lleva ese nombre ya que ellas son luchadoras y se esmeran por ir mejorando día a día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa está creciendo y mejorando. Maria, la presidenta de este grupo se dedica a la elaboración de productos de limpiezas que realiza gracias a las microfranquicias de limpieza que ofrece la fundación a sus señoras.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza y cumpliendo con sus clientes. Agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras (Fighting Women) is striving because its members want to succeed and to help their families. The group picked this name because the members are fighters who take great pains each day to improve. Maria, one of the members, is growing and improving through effort, continuous work, and behavior essential to a successful woman. She is the bank's president. 

Maria produces cleaning products under a franchise arrangement offered by the foundation to its women members. She has applied for a loan to buy cleaning micro franchises so that she can continue to produce cleaning products for her customers. She is grateful for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a micro franchise to produce cleaning products.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 33 years old, and both her children are in school.

Rosemarie has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Rosemarie has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a 40-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and four children. Her husband is a government employee, but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Her children are studying in government schools. 

Noreen is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 1998, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished; therefore, Noreen wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that, as a member of 3-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other variety of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the profit amount, she will pay the installments of the loan and school fees for her children. She dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture, Noreen is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es: Elkin de 37 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de un hijo de 10 años de edad. Desde hace más de 15 años se ha dedicado al mundo de los negocios, actividad que le ha permitido salir adelante y le ha enseñado grandes lecciones en la vida. Asegura que crear un empresa es un tarea que requiere de muchos conocimientos y la asesoría de expertos en mercado con el fin de no fracasar en el intento y generar grandes pérdidas. Motivo que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito con el fin de crear su propio negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Elkin is 37 years old. He is married and the father of a 10 year old son. He has worked in business for more than 15 years, which has allowed him to get ahead and has taught him many life lessons. He explains that starting a business is a task that requires a lot of knowledge and the advice of marketing experts so as not to fail and suffer big losses. This has motivated him to request a loan with the goal of starting a business and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for professional advice regarding starting his business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 59 años de edad,comenta que es una mujer felizmente casada y vive en su casa propia acompañada de su esposo, su hija, su yerno y su nieta. Irene era profesora pero hace poco decidió jubilarse por motivos de salud, y hace cuatro años que viene dedicandose a la venta de ropa , este trabajo lo realiza junto a su hija, quien sale a repartir la mercadería de manera ambulatoria . Anteriormente tenia pensado poner su propio negocio pero por falta de capital no podía llevarlo a cabo, pero con el apoyo de su esposo y con los ahorros que tenia pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable y con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas espera poner un local exclusivamente de venta de ropa.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y agradece el apoyo económico que se le brinda razón por la cual se compromete a  ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.El dinero solicitado de S/.1000 soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para niños y adultos y así poder surtir su negocio con mas productos.
texts.en:
Irene, 59, says she's a happily-married woman living in her own house in the company of her husband, daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter.  Irene used to be a teacher but decided to retire a short time ago due to health reasons.  For the last four years she has been selling clothes with her daughter who heads out to sell the merchandise from place to place.  She wanted to set up her own business some time ago but because of the lack of capital had been unable to do so.  However, with support from her husband and with saving she had she was able to move ahead and now has a stable business.  With profits earned from sales she’s hopes to open a store selling clothes exclusively.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the economic support she’s being given which is why she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy clothes for children and adults to stock her business with more products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, 56 años de edad habitante de la ciudad de Managua, viuda madre 2 hijos mayores de edad, ella es dueña de una pulpería. Negocio que inicio hace 6 años tenía muy poco capital vendía muy poco pero la necesidad de la clientela era constante esto la impulso a invertir la ganancia n surtir poco a poco su venta la cual tiene en su casa de habitación. 
Ella anhela ampliar más su casa para expandir el espacio de su pulpería y convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea bien surtida de productos comestibles y para uso doméstico.
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, queso, pollo, carne, detergentes, jabones, aceite etc.
texts.en:
56-year-old Nelis lives in the city of Managua. She is a widow and the mother of two grown-up children. 

She is the owner of a grocery store, a business that she started 6 years ago when she had very little capital and sold very little. But the needs of the customers were constant and this gave her the drive to invest the profits in supplying her shop little by little. The shop is in her home.

She longs to make her house bigger to expand the space for her grocery store and convert it into a corner shop well-stocked with groceries and domestic-use products. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, soda, cheese, chicken, meat, detergents, soap, oil e.t.c

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soda, cheese, chicken, meat, detergents, soap, oil e.t.c

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is 50 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three sons, and two daughters. Three of her children are currently studying in primary school. Dilshad's husband is a laborer, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Dilshad is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet their family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 20 years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Dilshad has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future, and her production can be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams of building her own house. She also desires to expand her business and to provide quality education to her children. With the profit created by the loan, she will pay the rent on her house. Dilshad and her family are very thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 23 years-old and engaged to be married.  He lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He has a bus that he bought three years ago in order to improve his quality of life and to cover household expenses. He says that he feels comfortable however he earns a low income. Recently, his bus is not working well but he needs assistance to cover the costs of purchasing spare parts.

Therefore, he applied for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to have another bus in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with only child. She is 22 years-old and resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Juliet has owned and operated a fishing business for 10 years earning  3,500 PHP . Aside from this business, she manages a retail store selling groceries in their community. To purchase canned goods and bottled products in addition to her working capital, she requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from  Kiva partner GDMPC micro credit. In the future, Juliet wants to improve and expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and bottled products in addition to her working capital.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She runs a kiosk and also sells fish, which helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy items for her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $450. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, and Fanta), and biscuits.

loans.name: Behilla

texts.en:
Behilla works hard to support her family. Behilla is married and has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Behilla requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more vegetables to sell from her vegetable stall.

Behilla has been in this business for 20 years now.

Behilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell from her vegetables stall.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is really encouraged and highly motivated by his light recharging business as a result of financing from Kiva. 

He is now seeking a top up loan of  RWF 30,000 in order to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Desire started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date (10 of which were funded by Kiva) providing clean energy to 150 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will be able to buy more and better food for his wife Dativa and their children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en: Ermetania is married with six children. She is 54 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years, and every month she earns about 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. Near her rice field, she also planted vegetables and watermelon for sale. In order to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit.  In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita, de 60 años de edad, esta divorciada del padre de sus 11 hijos quienes ya son personas adultas e independientes. Vive en compañía de 3 de sus hijos y 2 nietos, juntos habitan cómodamente en su casa propia.El trabajo que realiza Emerita es la compra y venta de diversos artículos de uso del hogar como escobas, bandejas, cestos, desinfectantes y otros artículos como bicicletas para niños, cunas y coches para bebés. Los productos que mayor preferencia tienen entre sus clientes son aquellos que se usan en la cocina como ollas, utensilios de mesa, sartenes, baldes entre otros. Ha instalado su negocio en un local alquilado. Trabaja sola desde hace 1 año. Su horario de atención es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Eventualmente se dedica a la venta de comida. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera buena rentabilidad ya que es el único negocio dedicado a este rubro y no hay otros puestos de venta similares. Se siente contenta  ya que ha obtenido grandes satisfacciones gracias a su trabajo, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral.Con el monto solicitado comprará escobas, baldes y artículos de cocina para continuar vendiendo en su negocio para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Emerita, who is 60 years old, is divorced from the father of her eleven children, who are already adults and independent. She lives in the company of three of her children and two grandchildren; they live comfortably together in the house she owns. 

The work that Emerita does is buying and selling various household articles like brooms, trays, baskets, disinfectants, and other articles like children's bicycles, cribs, and strollers. The products that her customers like best are those that are used in the kitchen, like pots, utensils, pans, buckets, and others. She has set up her business in a rented space where she has worked alone for one year. Her shop hours are from eight o'clock in the morning until ten o'clock at night. Occasionally, she earns money by selling meals. What she likes about this business is that it generates good profits since it is the only business specializing in this sector and there are no other similar shops. She feels happy because thanks to her work, she gets a sense of fulfillment. She really wants to continue working and being able to expand her business. 

At this time, Emerita is requesting 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN]. She is very touched to know that there are people who provide economic backing for her to continue carrying out her work. With the requested amount, she will buy brooms, buckets, and cooking articles to continue selling in her shop for this season.

loans.use: to purchase household products like buckets, brooms, and more.

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old hardworking and enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost three years. She purchase clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market at a profit. 

Razia is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life, but now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the improvement of her house. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

NOTE : In the picture Razia is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don jose habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos y asi podrá seguir llevando el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Jose lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children. He is a farmer who has been growing corn and sorghum for several years. This is how he earns his living and is able to bring food home daily. He farms year to year and it is the only way he knows how to earn a living. He is a hardworking, honest and responsible man. In spite of the conditions in which he lives, which are very humble, he doesn't get tired of working and providing the best for his family. 

He has made the decision to ask for a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies: fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, etc... and to improve the land where he plants, which is shown in the photograph. He hopes to have favourable results as he doesn't have any other source of income so he will be able to continue bringing food home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds etc...

loans.name: Antonio Ricaurte

texts.es:
Antonio de 38 años, es un padre ejemplar. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales son la luz de su existencia, considera que su familia es su mayor tesoro y el pilar que lo impulsa a salir adelante. Desde hace algunos años creó su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de licor, bebida y mecatos. Actividad que según él se ha convertido en la única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin aumentar sus ingresos. 
Su mayor sueño es aumentar su capacidad de venta y garantizarle a su hijo mayor de 17 años de edad la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Antonio is thirty-eight years old and is an exemplary father.  He has two children who are minors, and they are the light of his existence.  He considers his family to be his greatest treasure and the thing that motivates him to get ahead.  A few years ago, he created his own business in selling liquor, drinks, and snacks.  According to him, this activity is the only source of income for the sustenance of his home.  

Today, he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of supplies, with the final goal to increase his income.

His greatest dream is to grow his ability to sell and thereby guarantee his eldest son, who is seventeen years old, the opportunity to enter the university.

loans.use: to buy liquor, drinks, and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Amway products at wholesale.

loans.name: Glory Jean

texts.en:
Glory Jean, 31, is married with one child, who is still in school. She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Glory Jean has successfully paid back her previous loans and has requested a new loan of 36,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use this loan to buy more stock, like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, candies and biscuits, to sell in her general store and build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock, like bread, snack foods, soft drinks, candies and biscuits, to sell in her general store

loans.name: Balmore Galileo

texts.es: Don balmore vive en casa propia con su esposa el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios siembra maíz y maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar los gastos de su hogar, don balmore solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar los insumos necesarios como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, y todo lo necesario para tener una mejor cosecha y asi tener una mejor vida con su esposa.
texts.en:
Balmore lives in his own house with his wife.  He has been farming for several years, and he grows corn and sorghum.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to cover the household expenses.  

He is requesting a loan that will allow him to be able to buy the needed supplies like compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and everything needed to have a better harvest.  This way he will have a better life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 20 años de edad, es un hombre con grandes sueños y proyectos por cumplir. Con el fin de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su madre, decidió emprender su proyecto de empresa y abrió un local dedicado a la venta de pollo asado y bebidas. Negocio que tenido una gran aceptación por parte de la comunidad. Hoy sueña con prestar el servicio a domicilio con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Razones que lo han motivado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta ya que  no cuenta con recursos propios. 
Su mayor sueño es iniciar sus estudios universitarios y garantizarle a su madre una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Juan, 20, is a man with big dreams and projects to complete.  He decided to set up his own business so he could generate income to support his mother.  He opened a locale to sell grilled chicken and beverages, a business that has been well received in the community.

Now he dreams of offering delivery service so he can increase his sales and improve his service.  This has motivated him to request a loan to buy a motorcycle, because he doesn't have his own resources.

His biggest dream is to begin his university education and give his mother a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: María Elena Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad. Inició desde hace algunos meses con la creación de su negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y satisfacer una necesidad latente en el sector. Abrió al público una cafetería la cual atiende de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche todos los días. Asegura que el negocio se encuentra en etapa de crecimiento y ha tenido una gran aceptación por parte del sector en donde se encuentra ubicado. Hoy requiere de la compra de insumos con el fin de reforzar el inventario y garantizar una adecuada prestación del servicio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar dicha inversión.
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old. Some months ago, she opened her own business in order to improve her financial condition and fill an unmet need in the area. She opened a cafeteria to the public and works there from 6 in the morning until 9 at night every day. She assures us that the business is in a growth stage and has been widely accepted in the area where it is located. Today she needs to buy ingredients to stock up on inventory and guarantee an adequate service. That is why she is asking for a loan to make such an investment.

She dreams of owning her own home and guaranteeing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple products to prepare food.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, 25, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children. Her husband has operated an automobile workshop for four years. The family is facing financial problems due to a low monthly income.

Sonia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business to increase their income and savings. The main purpose of this loan is to enable her husband to buy new tools for automobile repairs and tune-ups. Her husband’s customer base will increase if he has the latest equipment and tools. 

In the future, with his profits, Sonia’s husband wants to expand his workshop by adding more space. Sonia is very hopeful that this loan could solve many of her family’s problems and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase tools for automobile repairs and tune-ups.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Jacinta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with nine children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Patricia has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock feed, medicine and fencing equipment

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 44-year-old responsible mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and children. Her husband is a woodcutter by profession, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own work.
 
Irshad, as a member of two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a rickshaw from the loan amount, and he would drive the rickshaw at night along with his present job. In this way, his monthly income would be increased, and they would be able to send their children to schools.

Irshad is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

NOTE: In the picture, Irshad is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Sofia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Sofia is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Sofia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Lidia Elizabeth

texts.es: Lidia vive con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años siembra maíz y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la vende en los comercios de compra-venta que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, lidia solicita un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos,  herbicidas, etc. y también para poder mejorar el terreno donde siembra sus cosechas para obtener una mejor ganancia  darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lidia lives with her husband and her children in their own home.  She has made a living in agriculture for fifteen years.  She grows corn and sorghum.  When her harvest is ready, she sells her items in the buying and selling markets that are close to her place of residence.  With the profits that she makes from her sales, she is able to cover the home expenses.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. She wants to be able to improve the land where she plants her harvest in order to make better profits, and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es: Loydith, de 25 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 1 pequeño hijo a quien le brinda mucha protección y amor, vive en su modesta casa propia construida gracias al fruto de sus ahorros.Loydith se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, leche, detergentes, jabones,entre otros. Tiene su negocio instalado en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad. Su mercadería la renueva cada 2 o 3 días dependiendo de la fluidez de las ventas. Atiende sola desde que empezó su negocio y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades típicas de una ama de casa, afirma que las ganancias económicas que recibe semanalmente son muy lucrativas y eso le brinda la tranquilidad necesaria para enfrentar los gastos básicos de su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará algunos productos comestibles necesarios para la venta en su puesto como arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos y leche.
texts.en:
Loydith, 25, is married and has a small child whom she loves and protects.  She lives in her own modest house, built thanks to her savings.

Loydith makes a living selling food products such as rice, bread, sugar, eggs, milk, detergent, soap, and other things.  Her business is set up in one of the busiest markets in the city.  She restocks her merchandise every two or three days, depending on sales.  She has tended her business alone from the beginning.

What she likes about her job is she can use her time to do other activities typical of a homemaker.  She says her weekly profits are lucrative, which gives her the peace she needs to deal with the basic household expenses.

Now she's requesting 600 soles [PEN].  She's very happy that she'll have some financial support to get ahead.  With the requested loan she'll buy some food products she needs to sell in her store, such as rice, oil, sugar, eggs, and milk.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Nelson Noe

texts.es: Don Nelson de 51 años de edad es un hombre trabajador, responsable, desde hace varios años se dedica a la producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside y también a la siembra de maíz. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  así poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Nelson, 51, is a hardworking and responsible man. For several years he has been working in the production and sales of dairy products in the area where he lives. He also grows corn. He has a very good clientele as he knows how to gain their trust. He offers quality and good prices in his products. 

He has decided to invest in the care of his cattle since his business depends on it. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy vitamins and feed for his cattle and thus be able to continue giving his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Omaira Janed

texts.es:
Omaira de 34 años, es ama de casa y madre soltera de un hijo de 6 años de edad. Con el fin generar ingresos para el sostenimiento y la educación de su hijo, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en capacitarse en un curso de cocina básica e iniciar con su proyecto de negocio, elaborando alimentos desde su vivienda.
Sueña con tener un gran restaurante, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Omaria is 34 years old, a housekeeper, and the single mother of a six year old son.  In order to generate an income with which to support and pay for her son's education, she is asking for a loan so she can train in basic cooking and start a business, making food from her home.

She wants to have a grand restaurant and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to take cooking classes.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta is 42 years old and lives in Marneuli District with her 14-year-old daughter. Sveta requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Sveta has no source of income. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Sveta requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Sveta has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this credit, Sveta will purchase clothing and bed linens to resell. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing and bed linens at wholesale prices and then resell among her villagers. She has no experience but is a very hard-working woman and will do her best to earn money. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bed linens for resale

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is a 38-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse, three sons and two daughters. Since 2008, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is a very hard-working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Bathuyag is 37 years old and lives with his wife, Baasansuren, two sons and a daughter in a small house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. His sons study at a local school and his daughter goes to local kindergarten. 

Bathuyag has been running his business of photography services in town since 2001 and has built a lot of customers over the years. He has been covering his family expenses from his business profit. 

He is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase inventory, materials and equipment to start producing frames and providing full service to his clients. He is a hardworking, diligent and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, materials and equipment to start producing frames and providing full service to his clients.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur is 39 years old and married with four children. She helps her fisherman husband by managing her own sari sari (convenience) store. For five years, her business earned her 3,500 PHP monthly. It is her desire to improve her business, so she has requested a loan of 5,000.PHP from GDMPC to purchase canned goods, noodles and milk. She plans to use her generated revenue to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles and milk

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for making ice cream.

Jovelyn has been in this business for eight years. Jovelyn also earns income from a general store and raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making ice cream

loans.name: Naheeda's Group

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 33-year-old, hard-working and responsible woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Naheeda's husband is a laborer but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 15 years and her clients always appreciate her work.

Naheeda, as a member of four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future and her production could be increased. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to expand her business and to provide quality education to her children. With the profit she earns, she will pay her house rent. Naheeda and her family are very thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.
NOTE: In the picture Naheeda is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for stitching dresses

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 46 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Nilda has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, cream and bread. 

Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es:
Omaira de 23 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de once meses. Laboró por varios años en el sector de confecciones pero a raíz del nacimiento de su hijo se retiró. Con el fin trabajar como independiente y dedicarle tiempo  a su bebe, Omaira se dedicó a las venta de productos por catálogo, actividad en la que ha tenido buenos resultados. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor con el fin de reducir costos y mejorar las ganancias. 
Asegura que su mayor prioridad es el bienestar de su hijo, por lo cual se esmera para sacarlo adelante y garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Omaira is 23 years old and the mother of an eleven-month-old son. She has worked for several years making clothing but when her son was born she left this occupation. She would like to work independently so that she can be with her baby. Omaira is selling products from a catalogue, which has been very successful for her. Now she is looking for a loan to use to buy an assortment of wholesale items. In doing so she will be able to reduce her expenses and improve her earnings. Her greatest priority is the well being of her son. She wants him to be successful. Also she wants him to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products from a catalog.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben de 31 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de la ebanistería, negocio que ha construido con sacrificio y años de trabajo. Se encuentra ubicada en la zona urbana del municipio de Montebello y presta el servicio de fabricación de  puertas, closet, ventanas, techos entre otros. 
Hoy su negocio le permite generar tres empleos y gracias a su buen desempeño se ha ganado un buen nombre en su localidad. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos (madera) para el desarrollo de su actividad, a fin de cumplir con los pedidos solicitados. Sueña con seguir creciendo no sólo en el mercado local si no crear puntos de venta en los municipios aledaños.
texts.en:
Ruben, who is 31 years old, works as a cabinetmaker, a business that he built with sacrifice and years of work. It is located in the urban zone of the town of Montebello, and he offers services of making doors, closets, windows, and roofs, among other items.

Today his business allows him to create three jobs, and thanks to his good performance, he has earned a good name in his district. Now he is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of supplies (wood) to develop his business, with the goal of filling the orders that have been requested. He dreams of continuing to grow, not only in the local market but also to create sales locations in adjacent towns.

loans.use: to buy supplies (wood)

loans.name: Edencia

texts.en: Edencia is a woman with patience and dedication to their farming business. She is 58 years old and is married with three hard-working children. With the intent of improving her usual income, Edencia is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seed. She hopes that she can create higher income from the loan to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old and lives in the small village of Ambrolauri District with her mother, who receives a retirement pension. Marina requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two pigs and walnut trees. They sell the harvested walnuts locally at a good price but it is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marina requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Marina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this credit, Marina will purchase two milking cows. After purchasing milking cows, she will be able to produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Adi

texts.en: Adi, 38, is a builder who does home construction and makes home facilities. He has pursued this vocation for 10 years. In one project, he was assisted by several workers. Currently he is working on a house and it requires working capital loans to buy raw materials, such as cement, wood, nails and carpentry tools. Adi lives with his wife and two children who are still in school. He hopes with this loan, he could work on the project on time, customers will be satisfied with his work and he will be able to save enough to run this business with his own capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and carpentry tools

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha has a business selling vegetables to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan of $600. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as vegetables. 

Joaninha is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nancy Edith

texts.es: Perfumes, bolsos, calzados y ropa en general, fue lo que compró Nancy cuando recibió su credikiva. Con esta inversión amplió sus ventas y abrió nuevas líneas de productos, su negocio se encuentra mas surtido y con sus ventas pudo viajar dos veces a Ciudad de Panamá, de donde trae la mercancía que vende, como calzado, perfumes etc. A sus financiadores envía el siguiente mensaje: “ Les doy las gracias y espero que me sigan apoyando,  ya que mi sueño es tener un almacén mas grande. En la actualidad Nancy está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana, materia prima para confeccionar y mercancía variada que tiene encargada por sus clientes, haciendo así, de esta inversión la mas exitosa del año.
texts.en:
Perfumes, purses, shoes, and general clothing was what Nancy bought when she got her Kiva loan.  This investment expanded her sales and she opened up new lines of products.  Her business is better stocked and her sales have allowed her to travel to Panama City two times from where she brings merchandise such as shoes, perfumes, etc.

She sends the following message to her lenders, "I thank you and hope that you continue to support me because my dream is to have a large store."  Nancy currently is using her Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine, supplies, clothes making supplies, and various types of merchandise that customers have requested, making this investment the most successful this year.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es: Don Oscar de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el trabaja de albañil desde hace varios con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logar cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Oscar solicita un crédito para comprar materiales como ladrillos, cementos, arena, etc. para construir los baños sanitarios en su hogar ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizar esa inversión y poder tener los servicios necesarios en su hogar.
texts.en: Oscar is 37 years old, lives in his own house with his wife, and has worked as a bricklayer for the past few years. With the profits that he obtains from his work, he covers some expenses of his home. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials like bricks, cement, sand, etc to construct bathrooms in his home, since what he earns now is not enough to make this investment and be able to have the necessary services in his home.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks, cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Doña vilma de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Doña vilma quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, faldas, camisetas, pantalones y todo los necesario para su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and family. She works selling clothing, and has worked in the business for several years. It has given her much experience which allows her to obtain better profits. The business is located at her home. She has earned many customers because people know that everything is good quality, at accessible prices. 

Vilma wants to make a new investment, but does not have sufficient capital to support her. For that reason, she is requesting a loan which would allow her to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, and all that is necessary for her business. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and at the same time she has hope that it will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is 32 years old and lives in Bolnisi district with her retired parents-in-law. Lili requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Lili’s parents-in-law.
Lili requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lili has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Lili will purchase a stock of groceries to open a grocery shop. She already has a commercial space, which is located in a populous area. In order to decrease the expenses Lili will work in the shop as a seller herself. This will significantly increase the profit. Part of the profit Lili will be using to purchase more varieties of products to satisfy clients' needs better. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of groceries to open a grocery shop

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old married woman. She is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of cloth selling for almost 7 years. She purchases cloth from different areas and sells in the main market for profit.

Shehnaz is the responsible mother of three children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life - there were often days when her children slept without having any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family.

To cope with increasing demand during the summer season, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of cloth in different colors. She is a member of a two-person group. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of her profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

NOTE: In the picture, Shehnaz is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cloth to sell

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Anselma works hard to support her family.

She has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising livestock. Anselma is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Anselma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 54 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en compañía de su esposo y su hijo Iván de 30 años de edad, juntos habitan la casa que construyeron en un terreno heredado a su esposo.La actividad que realiza Lina es la costura. Trabaja en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir y lencerías para damas, caballeros y niños. Aprendió este oficio estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Se inició en este rubro hace 20 años, inicialmente tenía solo una máquina de coser que compró con sus ahorros. Su centro de labores se encuentra en un amplio espacio de su hogar. Actualmente tiene 2 máquinas que le permiten culminar una obra en corto tiempo. Su clientela esta conformada principalmente por sus familiares y sus vecinos que reconocen la calidad de su trabajo. Se siente a gusto y cómoda realizando este oficio, es por eso que tiene planes de ampliar el espacio de su taller para mayor comodidad y exhibir sus trabajos terminados.En esta  oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permitirá avanzar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará 1 máquina remalladora además de materiales de confección como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros.
texts.en: Lina is 54 years old, married, with three children. She lives with her husband and her son Ivan, who is 30 years old. They live together in a house that her husband inherited. Lina is a seamstress. She cuts and sews clothing and underclothes for women, men and children. She learned this skill from studying at an occupational school. She has been doing this work for twenty years. At first she had one sewing machine that she bought with her savings. She works in a sufficient space in her home. Now she has two sewing machines, which allow her to finish a project in less time. Her customers are mainly people she knows and her neighbors. They know the quality of her work. She likes her work and feels comfortable doing it. This is why she would like to increase the size of her workshop. This would make her more comfortable and she would also have room to show her finished products. She is requesting a loan of 3800 soles. She is thankful for the financial support that will help her increase her business. With the money that she is requesting she will buy a serger machine and more sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic and other things.

loans.use: to buy a serger machine, fabric, thread, elastic and other items.

loans.name: Estiben De Jesús

texts.es: Estiben de 43 años de edad, es un hombre amante al campo, desde su infancia. Aprendió sobre el cultivo de la tierra gracias a su padre, quien dedicó toda su vida a la agricultura. Hoy Estiben sigue los mismos pasos en una pequeña finca que adquirió gracias a años de trabajo. Tiene sembrados de café, y en conjunto con su esposa se dedica de tiempo completo a la ejecución de la actividad. En la actualidad requiere de un crédito para la compra de abono, fumigantes y mano de obra, con el fin de sacar una cosecha de calidad y aumentar los ingresos. Sueña con expandir su producción y llegar a convertirse en un gran exportador.
texts.en: Estiben is 43 years old. He is a man who has loved the land since his infancy. He learned about cultivating the land thanks to his father, who worked all his life in agriculture. Today Estiben follows the same path on a little farm that he acquired thanks to years of work. He has plantings of coffee, and together with his wife, he works full time in this activity. Now he needs a loan to buy compost and fumigants and pay for labor, with the goal of having a quality harvest and increasing his income. He dreams of expanding his production and becoming a great exporter.

loans.use: to buy compost and fumigants and pay for labor

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla, tiene 36 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, habita en la ciudad de Managua, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella comenzó con su negocio hace 10 años en el mundo del comercio vendiendo ropa y cosméticos. Tiene una buena clientela fija que siempre la busca para hacerle pedidos. Ella también ofrece sus productos a salones de belleza y empresas. Su proyecto es lograr ser una comerciante mayorista. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cosméticos, shampo, cremas, perfumes. Sobre todo  le será gran beneficio para aprovechar la temporada del día de las madres que las ventas son altas.
texts.en:
Karla is 36 years old, married, mother of 2 children, lives in the city of Managua, and works selling cosmetics. She started her business 10 years ago in the world of sales, selling clothing and cosmetics. 

She has a good customer base that always looks for her to make orders. She also offers her products to beauty salons and companies. Her project is to be a wholesale seller. She is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and perfumes. Above all, it will be a great benefit to her to take advantage of the season of Mother's Day when sales are high.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shampoo, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Andrés De Jesús

texts.es:
Andrés de 30 años de edad,  es un campesino dedicado al sector agrícola. Narra que desde los once años aprendió de la actividad gracias a su padre. Desde hace ocho años inició con su propio negocio, dedicado a la producción de leche la cual distribuye entre su comunidad y la demás es vendida a una empresa de lácteos. Gracias al desarrollo de su labor hoy sus tres hijos menores de edad, gozan de una buena educación. 
Con el fin de aumentar su producción, Andrés se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una estacionaria y dos terneras. Mejorando así sus ingresos y transformando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is 30 years old, and a farmer dedicated to the agricultural sector. He says that since he was 11 years old, he learned the activity thanks to his father. For the past 8 years, he started with his own business, dedicated to the production of milk, which he distributes in his community and sells the rest to a dairy company. 

Thanks to the development of his work, today his three young children enjoy a good education. With the goal of increasing his production, Andrés finds himself requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a stable and two calfs. This will allow him to increase his income and the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stable and two calfs.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a married man blessed with five children. He is already 50 years old. His main source of income is from rice farming. He has been doing this activity for 21 years. Last harvest season, Alexander was able to generate a net income of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which has been used for their daily expenditures and other needs. At his age, Alexander now has difficulty working in the field doing all the work; thus, he is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to pay for farm laborers who will do the land preparation. He's hoping that his loan request will be granted so that he can utilize it in his agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for farm laborers who will do the land preparation

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 54 years old and lives in the small village of Sagarejo District with her husband, two sons and two daughter-in-laws. Manana requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have a vineyard. They pick the grapes and Manana produces ‘Churchkhela,’ a Georgian delicacy prepared from grapes strung on a thread in the nut flour thickened grape juice, to sell. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Manana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Manana will open a bakery. After the bakery is opened, they will bake Georgian bread. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is 42 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of five children and is a responsible and hard-working housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to the insufficient income he is facing problems to meet the needs of his family. Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase a variety of furniture to sell. By doing so he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Rafia is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase new furniture

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 42 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of five children. She owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery cloths are liked by everyone. Presently her stock of embroidery material is almost depleted, therefore she wants to purchase a variety of embroidery materials including colorful threads, beads, stones, needles and clothes. For that purpose Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business. With the profit, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit so that she could easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan because this will help her to fulfill her needs.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
A $1,000 (USD) loan is offered to Rosalina to improve her business, a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy additional stock such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Rosalina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 37 years old and is a hardworking and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and four sons. Her husband is a security guard. His income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For eight years, Rani has been running a beauty salon. She wants to purchase more cosmetic products, such as makeup kits, facial scrubs, and nail polish, and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. When she makes a profit, in addition to repaying the loan, she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space is now congested. 

She hopes that her business grows. She is very thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 22-year-old, young and energetic woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband. He is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. She is living in a rented house and she wants to build her own house.

Sumaira is a very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for five years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of bed sheets and cloth from other cities at a lower price and then sell it for profit. This loan could fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 40-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her spouse, three sons, and two daughters. 

Since 2010, Khalida's husband has been running a small vegetable shop. He usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. Khalida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her husband's shop. With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables. This will allow him to offer more variety to his clients and increase his sales and income. 

Khalida's husband is a very hardworking and honest man. He is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don Pedro vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad,  el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, don Pedro solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes., abonos, herbicidas, etc. y también para mejorar el terreno donde siembra para seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna
texts.en: Pedro lives in his own home with his wife and their two children, ages 18 and 20. He has been farming for 3 years, primarily planting corn and beans. With the sales from his harvests he is able to cover their household expenses. Pedro asks for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc and also to improve the land where he plants so that he can continue giving his family the things that they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en: Agusta is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She runs a business selling firewood from her house. Agusta opened her kiosk in 2010 with $300 in working capital. She lives in a town near the main road so many people buy wood from her everyday. She makes a good income and wants to buy more stock with the loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Tamriko

texts.en:
Tamriko, 27 years old, lives in Kutaisi district with her son, who attends school. Tamriko requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without success, her requests repeatedly rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. Tamriko has a plot of land where she grows melons and watermelon, selling them to resellers and earning only a small monthly income that is rarely enough to cover monthly expenses.

Tamriko requested a loan from Credo to start a family business, a request approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her loan, Tamriko will cultivate more land, plant more fruits and vegetables, pay workers and purchase seed. Later she will have a good harvest which will be sold to the resellers. Tamriko will thereby increase her profit and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cultivate more land and plant more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, who is single, works hard to support her family. For five years now, she has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and  earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Marilyn has  requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

NOTE: Marilyn belongs to the third sex gender community.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años vive en casa propia con su familia, siembra maíz y maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a su familia en los gastos de la casa,  el cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, etc.  para seguir con su cosecha y seguir ayudando en su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The loan recipient has been a farmer for three years. He lives in his own home with his family, and plants corn and sorghum. With his earnings he gets from his sales he helps his family with household expenses. He asks for a loan to buy needed inputs like compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc so that he can continue with his harvest and keep helping at home without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Victor Emilio

texts.es:
Víctor de 62 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia. Se dedica a la elaboración de artículos para el aseo como escobas, traperas, cepillo entre otros. Actividad con la que se ha ganado la vida y le ha permitido sostener a su familia. 
Sus productos son comercializados en diferentes tiendas del sector y a particulares. Con el fin de cumplir con la producción solicitada por un cliente, Víctor se encuentra pidiendo un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima. 
Sueña con sacar adelante su pequeña negocio y penetrar nuevos mercados a fin de mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Victor is 62 years old and is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. He makes cleaning articles such as brooms, mops, and brushes. He has always made a living in this way and it has allowed him to provide for his family. He sells his products in various different stores and directly to customers. In order to meet a client's order, Victor is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials. He dreams of making his small business successful and hopes to penetrate new markets in order to improve his income as well as the quality of life in his household.

loans.use: to buy materials to make cleaning articles to sell.

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Martha, 55 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada desde hace 12 años. Negocio que inicio hace 12 años cuando sus primeros productos fueron los cosméticos por catálogo que vendía de puerta en puerta los premios que obtenía por ventas ella los guardaba para después venderlos, después compro una vitrina y la surtió de productos para el hogar asi como el servicio de fotocopias así fue recaudando capital para comprar mercadería variada. Hoy en día vende ropa, cosméticos, impresiones a color, fotocopias y artículos escolares. De esta manera se gana la vida a diario.
Ella está necesitando el crédito para comprar ropa interior de mujer, perfumes, cremas, cuadernos, lapiceros, libretas, borradores, lápices de colores, cartulinas. Uno de sus proyectos es lograr poner un Cyber café estudiantil.
texts.en:
Martha, 55, is married and a mother of three grown children. She has been a merchant, selling a variety of goods, for 12 years. When she started her business her first products were cosmetics from a catalog that she sold door to door. She saved the prizes that she won in order to later sell them. She then bought a display case and stocked it with products for the home, and also added photocopying servies. She was able to recoup her capital this way in order to diversify her merchandise. Now she sells clothing, cosmetics, color printing, photocopies and school supplies. This is how she earns her living.

She needs a loan to buy women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, notebooks, pens, folders, erasers, colored pencils and poster board. One of her projects is to be able to add an internet cafe for students.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear, perfumes, lotions, notebooks, pens, folders,erasers, colored pencils and poster board.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP12000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Felina has been in this business for one year. Felina earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Felina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

NOTE: Her primary business is selling fish. In the picture she has a small and big boxes of fish and a weighing scale for her business. They keep each box closed to stay fresh the fish. Beans are bought for their consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jurita

texts.en:
Jurita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Jurita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jurita has been in this business for 35 years.

In the future, Jurita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This time, for her 16th loan, Marites is borrowing PHP 30,000 to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery and feed for her pigs. 

The general store business that was previously funded through NWTF and its Kiva partner continue to provide for Marites and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Sidonia

texts.en: Sidonia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second hand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Noemia

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Noemia, to improve her business. She has a fish-selling business where many people come to buy every day. With the loan, she will buy some equipment for fishing. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Noemia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Senorinha

texts.en: Senorinha is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She runs a fish-selling business in front of her fishing boats. She will use the loan to buy items to keep in her fishing boats, such as equipment for fishing. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy equipment for fishing

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 55-year-old man. He’s married and living in Lebanon with his wife and four children; two are working, while the others are still studying. Despite his tough work, Afif is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for covering his family's expenses. He has been working in the construction field since 1993. He’s specialized in floor coverings and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing new tools, as he plans to keep on offering the best quality of work ever. In the near future, Afif plans to take added loans to open his own pavers shop. This is how he works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new tools.

loans.name: Syver

texts.en:
Syver is a 28-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. Syver started selling lights in November 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, Marie Providence, and their two children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
