loans.name: Grover

texts.es: Grover de 55 años de edad , es padre soltero de 4 hijos de 23, 21, 20 y 14 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia.Grover se dedica a trabajar como obrero de construcción.Lleva realizando este trabajo por 2 años de manera independiente ya que antes de eso trabajaba bajo la autoridad de otras personas y fue de esta forma como aprendió y ganó mucha experiencia para poder hacerlo ahora con mucho esmero y responsabilidad. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene muchos contratos y siempre realiza su trabajo con resultados óptimos, tiene sus ingresos regulados de acuerdo a los trabajos que hace, tiene autonomía en su economía y desea seguir trabajando e implementándose con herramientas que le permitan realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará algunas herramientas que necesita para continuar con su trabajo como desarmadores, martillos y tablas para construcción.
texts.en: Grover is 55 years old and a single father to his four children who are aged 23, 21, 20 and 14 years old.  They all live with their father in his privately-owned home.  Grover makes a living as a construction worker.  He has been doing this work independently for two years.  Previously, he worked for others and learned his trade and gained a lot of experience with them so that he can now work independently responsibly and with care.  Grover's work is going well as he has many contracts and he always has the best possible results.  He earns according to how much work he does and is financially independent.  Grover wants to continue working and using tools that allow him to work much more quickly.  On this occasion he is applying for 1000 Nuevo Soles and is grateful to all those who are providing this loan that will be necessary for him to achieve his goals.  Grover promises to make his repayments.  With the loan, Grover will buy some tools that he needs to continue with his work, including hammers, planks of wood and screwdrivers.

loans.use: to buy hammers, planks of wood and screwdrivers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фарруху 30 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 3 года. Фаррух не имеет высшее образование, так как по семейным обстоятельствам он не смог поступить в университет. Данное время он занимается производством кирпича. Он производит кирпич у себя дома. Его жена Махфуза помогает ему в производстве кирпича. Она работает учительницей в средней школе и в свободное время помогает мужу. Полученный доход они используют для покупки продуктов питания и одежды. Уже несколько лет они планируют отремонтировать крышу дома, но так как не имеют большой доход, они не в состоянии купить шифер, древесину и другие необходимые строительные материалы. Фаррух запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки шифера, древесины и других необходимых средств. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farruh is 30 years old. He is married and raising a child who is 3 years of age. Farruh has no post-secondary education as, due to family circumstances, he was unable to go to university. Presently, he manufactures bricks at home. He does this with help from his wife Mahfuza who works as a high school teacher and assists her husband in her spare time. The couple use their income to pay for food and clothing.

For several years, the family has been planning to repair the roof of their house, but due to their limited income have not been able to purchase slate, lumber and other building materials. Farruh is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy these supplies. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy slate, lumber and other supplies for repairing the roof of his house

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is 47 years old and married. He is a farmer, raising wheat and vegetables, which he has been doing for 15 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables. Bahodur sells his crop in the local market.  His wife actively helps him to raise his crops.

Bahodur is requesting a loan for 6,000 somoni, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizers.  As his products are in high demand, Bahodur wants to expand his business and produce more wheat and vegetables to cover market demand.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is 28 years old, from Gaza. She is married and has one child.

She has owned a poultry farm since 2008. Aminah asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to enlarge the space of the poultry farm and do needed maintenance. She hopes that this loan will increase the farm's productivity and, thus, improve her family's income.

The one who appears in the picture is Aminah's husband, due to a cultural issue.

loans.use: to enlarge the space of the poultry farm and do needed maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María, tiene 52 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos. Reside en uno de los Barrios de San Pedro Sula. Doña María, tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de tortillas y obtiene otros ingresos con la recolecta de plásticos, hierro, cobre y otros artículos de reciclaje para vender en una empresa recicladora. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo en ODEF por 17,500 lempiras para comprar harina de maíz para elaborar tortillas y compra de artículos en mal estado para reventa. Su meta es incrementar la producción de tortillas y continuar con el negocio de compra y venta de artículos de reciclaje, para poder obtener ingresos que le permitan mejorar su vivienda y las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is 52 years old and lives with her husband, with whom she has three children. She lives in a neighbourhood of San Pedro Sula. For five years, María has had her own business selling tortillas, and she earns additional income collecting plastic, iron, copper and other items which she sells to a recycling company. She has decided to request a second loan from ODEF for 17,500 Lempiras to buy corn flour to make tortillas, and to buy second hand items for resale. Her goal is to increase the amount of tortillas she produces and to continue with her business of buying and selling recyclable items, so that she can earn the income she needs to improve her home and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn flour to make tortillas, and to buy second hand items for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La Sra. Emma tiene 28 años,  casada con dos hijos de las edades de 13 y 7 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Charapaqui este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emma va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca el día de la Madre y también la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Emma enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Emma se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Emma, 28, is married and has two children whose ages are 13 and 7 years and are school age.  She works selling clothes according to the season.  Her sales stand is located in the Charapaqui zone.  

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Emma will use this loan to buy clothes like sweaters and jackets at wholesale to stock her business since Mother’s Day as well as the cold season are approaching and she gets lots of orders and sells more at this time.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital.  Emma faces the business challenge of daily competition.  

She will use profits to continue improving her sales stand.  Her wish for her business is to have more assorted merchandise to offer a good variety of products to her customers.  Emma feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because it allows her to improve in business and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, and pesticides and to pay to rent the land.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна чистоплотная и добродушная женщина. Ей 34 года. Она воспитывает 2 дочерей сама, так как 5 лет назад ее любимый муж умер. Ее дочерям 8 и 6 лет. Мавзуна работает в местной поликлинике медсестрой. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так там мало высококвалифицированных медработников. Она является одной из успешных медработников. Все местные жители знают и уважают ее. Она упорно и честно работает с утра до вечера. Полученную зарплату использует для обеспечения детей. Ее дочери уже несколько лет просят ее купить мебель для их комнаты, но Мавзуна не может сделать сбережения и купить мебель. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 сомони для покупки мебели. Этот займ поможет сделать счастливой двух дочерей Мавзуны.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a neat and good-natured woman of 34. She is raising 2 daughters on her own as her beloved husband passed away 5 years ago. Her daughters are 8 and 6 years old. Mavzuna works as a nurse at the local clinic. She lives in a rural area where highly trained medical professionals are rare. Mavzuna is very good at her job and is known and respected by the local populace. She works hard from morning until night and spends her salary on her children.

Mavzuna's daughters have been asking her for new furniture for their room for several years, but Mavzuna is unable to save enough for the purchase. She is requesting a loan of 1300 somoni to buy the furniture. This loan will make her two daughters very happy.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughters' room

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Marthaline is 29 years old and operates a table at the market, selling cookies in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water, and lots of transportation options.  

Marthaline is married, with three children aged between 13 and 9. They are living at home with her and they are currently attending school. 

Marthaline does not read or write. For the past two years, she has been selling cookies in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 6pm, and most of the time she uses a shard-taxi to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, butter, sugar, baking powder, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, butter, sugar, baking powder, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El señor Lucas, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa, hijos y su suegra. Hace 4 años que se dedica a vender verduras como bananos, repollo, chiles, tomate, cebolla, papas, etc. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en una carreta de caballos ofreciendo sus productos en otros barrios y colonias de la ciudad. El esta solicitando un préstamo por 6,500 Lempiras para comprar verduras, frutas de temporada y compra de cerdos para engorde y vender. Su plan es obtener siempre los ingresos para  poderle dar un estudio a sus hijos para que sean mejor que el y mejorar las condiciones de vida, tambien piensa en mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Lucas, 35, has four children and lives in an outlying neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife, children and mother-in-law.  He’s been working selling vegetables like bananas, cabbage, chilies, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. for four years.  He sells from place to place from a horse-driven cart in various neighborhoods and sections of the city.  

He’s requesting a 6,500 Lempira loan to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables and also to buy pigs to fatten up and sell.  His plan is to always earn income to be able to provide schooling for his children so they can be better than him and to improve living conditions; he also intends to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Eduardo Edgar

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 42 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Eduardo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones de Cerdo para compartir con su familia y amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eduardo se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parecela arrendada donde siembra naranjas, el trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eduardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono y compra de plaguicidas, de esta manera Eduardo podrá tener su cultivo en mejores condiciones y con ello asegurará una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Eduardo’s a 42-year-old single man living in the city of Nazca.  He’s a very humble, hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work while still very young to help his parents, Eduardo was unable to study a professional career.  In his free moments he likes to spend some time reading and sometimes cooks delicious fried pork to share with his family and friends.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Eduardo works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel of leased land where he grows oranges.  He works every day doing the field chores and can work for about 8 hours daily.  He feels good doing his work and thinks that he does well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Eduardo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to cover the cost of buying manure and pesticide so he can keep his crop in better conditions thus insuring a good harvest.  He will continue working and striving to reach his great dream of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weedkiller, insecticide and pesticide, among other supplies.

loans.name: Safarqul

texts.ru: Сафаркулу 48 лет. Он женат. Сафаркул отец  и дедушка. У него четверо детей и трое внуков. Сафаркул со своей семьей живет в юго-западной части Таджикистана в районе Хуросон. Сафаркул имеет только среднее образование. Он спокойный и добрый человек. Жена Сафркула портниха, она у себя дома занимается вышиванием национальных платьев. Сам Сафаркул занимается ремонтом автомашины. Он раньше занимался земледелием, сейчас эту деятельность продвигает его семья. Сафаркул в детстве занимался скотоводством. Он хочет начать и продолжить этот вид деятельности. Сафаркул берет кредит для закупа 7-голов крупно-рогатого скота с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. В будущем он планирует расширить бизнес и открыть ферму.
texts.en:
Safarqul is 48 years old and married. He is a father and a grandfather with four children and three grandchildren. Safarqul and his family live in the south-west of Tajikistan in the Khuroson region. Safarqul has secondary education. He is a calm and kind person. His wife is a seamstress who works at home by making traditional dresses. Safarqul works in automotive repair. He was a farmer previously, but has since left that activity to his family.

As a child, Safarqul tended livestock. He would like to return to this activity and start his own business.  He is taking this loan to purchase 7 heads of cattle in order to fatten and resell them. In the future, he plans to expand his business and start his own farm.

loans.use: to buy 7 cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ntombiyezwe

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 28-year-old Ntombiyezwe, who lives in the town of Bulawayo. She is a single parent with one child who attends the local school.  She earns a living by running a small retail business where she sells clothes, shoes, blankets and men's and women's suits. She has been in this line of work for two years and says that her main challenge is the competition. She is requesting a loan for $500 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She says the extra income generated by this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees and meet other household expenses. In the future, Ntombiyezwe plans to open a clothing boutique in town.

loans.use: to buy new winter stock to sell, including blankets, wool hats, shoes, and jackets.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 21 years old and is from Nablus. He works with his father selling fruits and vegetables a business his father started 15 years ago.

Ibrahim is requesting a youth loan from Ryada, which he will use to buy and install umbrellas above the stalls to cover the fruits and vegetables. With this loan, he will be able to increase the goods displayed and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase umbrellas to cover the fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jerelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Jerelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

Jerelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más mercadería, ya que vende ropa ambulante; este le permitirá comprar blusas, camisas, faldas, chores, calzonetas, pantalones, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos del  hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado  y la familia se encuentran muy bien.
texts.en:
Teofila is asking for a new loan because she needs more merchandise. She sells clothes as a street vendor. This loan will allow her to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts, swimming trunks and trousers, among others. 
The previous loan helped her to increase her sales and she is investing her income in the household expenses. The economic conditions have improved and her family's living situation is good.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, skirts, shorts, swimming trunks, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 31 years old, single and works very hard to provide for her children by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Christine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 46 años de edad , está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia.María se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, entre los que se encuentran arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras, golosinas, bebidas y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su hogar , la cual está ubicada en una esquina de la avenida principal de su distrito, ahí atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando 5 años en este rubro aunque al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su padre ahora el negocio es solo de ella.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la gran variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su zona .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará productos para su tienda tales como golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros.
texts.en:
María, 46, is married and has two children who are 11 and 14 years of age respectively; she lives with them in her own house.  María sells edible products among which are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables, snacks, soft-drinks and others.  The business is located at home which is located on a corner in her district’s main avenue.  She’s open every day full-time.  She’s been working in this line of work for five years although at the beginning her father helped her; today the business is just hers though.  What she likes about her work is that she has time to do her other occasional chores.  Fortunately, she does very well because she always has customers thanks to the great variety of goods she offers and because she’s the only store in her zone.

On this occasion she’ll ask for 1,000 soles and she’s very happy for the financial support she’s being offered to continue with her work.  She will use the requested amount to buy products for her store like snacks, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables and others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo y por la facilidad de pago que la Institución brinda; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para realizar el cultivo tales como: abono, semilla de maíz, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas y para la preparación de la tierra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener una buena producción; las condiciones económicas han mejorado un poco  y también las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: José’s asking for a new loan because he needs more working capital and because of the easy loan terms the Institution offers.  This will make it possible for him to buy the farm supplies like manure, corn seeds, herbicide, pesticide and fungicide needed for his crops as well as to prepare the soil.  His previous loan helped him get a good crop yield and his economic conditions have improved a little as well as his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Sinkor, in Montserrado County, where Monrovia, the capital city of Liberia, is well-known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 28 years old, living together with her fiancee and two children, 10 and 14 years old. The children are currently attending school and live at home.

For the past ten years, she has been running a table in the market where she sells rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onion, salt, etc. She sells from Monday through Saturday, 7am to 6pm. By the means of a shared taxi, she gets her goods to her table every time. She started this business with help from her fiancee and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes her business because it gives her more profits and make her popular, 

Christine is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onion, salt, etc. for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onion, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a 59-year-old widow with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been farming for 21 years and has taken out 23 prior loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Idalia es una mujer de joven 33 años de edad y madre de 3 hijos los cuales el mayor estudia en la secundaria en el primer curso de ciclo común básico, el segundo hijo en la escuela en el 4 grado los cuales al salir de sus actividades escolares ayudan a sus padres en el campo en lo que es maíz, frijoles y arroz. Ella tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el tercer curso de la secundaria y no pudo continuar estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabar la tierra desde muy pequeña. En compañía de su pareja trabajan la tierra hace más de 7 años y las tierras que trabajan son alquiladas por lo tanto se ven en la dura tarea de trabajar más de lo normal para poder ver resultados ya que ellos dividen las ganancias con los propietarios del terreno los cuales están ubicadas a 4 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual en ocasiones se trasladan en carro o a pie siendo ellos los únicos que se involucran en esta actividad como familia. 

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares para dar mantenimiento y asegurar sus cultivos ya que con las diferentes variaciones de precios en el mercado y los cambios climáticos es necesario el mantenimiento para una buena cosecha y un grano seguro.

Su sueño es poder comprar un pedazo de tierra en el cual ellos puedan cultivar y poder sembrar lo propio para que las ganancias sean compartidas pero entre ellos como familia ya que son los únicos que se involucran de esa manera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean personas profesionales, prósperas, con mucho éxito en la vida y personas triunfadoras.
texts.en:
Idalia, 33, is a young mother of three children.  The oldest attends the first course in the basic cycle of secondary school; her second son is in fourth grade.  When they get out of school they help their parents with the field chores growing corn, beans and rice.  She’s completed the third course of secondary school but was unable to continue studying due to the lack of economic support from her parents who taught her since she was very little how to work the land.  

She and her spouse have worked the land for more than 7 years together and the land they grow on is leased so they must work harder than normal to see good results because they share their profits with the owners of the land which is located four kilometers away from their house.  Sometimes they reach it by car and sometimes they walk; they are the only ones who do this work as a family.

She’s asking for help today to buy fertilizer, manure and leaf fertilizer to provide maintenance and safeguard their crops because due to price fluctuations and changes in the weather it’s necessary to provide maintenance in order to have good crop yields and secure grains.

Her dream is to be able to buy a piece of land they can grow on and to be able to grow for themselves so that the profits can be shared but only among themselves as a family since they are the only ones involved this way to continue being able to support their children’s schooling so that they can become professional, prosperous people with much success in life and to be victorious.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for community health work and taxi business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in the village of Sinkor in Montserrado County, which is the capital region of Liberia and its commercial center. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children, aged 15 and 9, who live at home and attend a local school. She describes herself as hardworking woman, and has for the past several years earned a living by selling fish in a local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned the trade from her friends. She does her selling six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. and enjoys her work. She is requesting this loan to buy more fish to sell, and plans to use the additional income she earns to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Madlyn

texts.es: Madlyn, de 33 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida en una parte del terreno de su madre. El negocio que tiene Madlyn es la venta de comidas regionales por las noches como   anticuchos, pollo asado, chorizos y otros además de preparar almuerzos. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes y esta actitud sumada a su buena sazón le ha permitido obtener muy buena acogida y demanda. Realiza este negocio desde hace 2 años con la ayuda de otra señora. Complementa sus platillos con la venta de deliciosos refrescos elaborados con frutas frescas como maracuyá y cocona.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes, no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero y es por eso que se compromete a ser muy puntual y sobre todo muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de sus platillos como carnes, plátanos, aceite, condimentos, arroz y otros.
texts.en:
Madlyn, 33, is married and has three children she lives with in her own house built on part of her mother’s land.  Madlyn’s business is selling regional dishes like ‘anticuchos’ [skewered grilled meats], grilled chicken, sausages, and others in the evening; she also prepares lunches.  She treats her customers very kindly and this attitude added to her tasty preparations have led her to be very well-received and to be in demand.  She’s been doing this for two years with help from another lady.  She complements her dishes selling delicious beverages made from fresh fruit like passion fruit and ‘cocona’ [edible Andean berry].

On this occasion she’ll request 800 soles.  She’s very excited and grateful for this economic backup she’s being offered to continue with her plans.  She does not want to miss her payments for lack of money so she’s committing to being very punctual and above all responsible with her installment payments.  She will use the requested amount to progressively buy all the ingredients like meats, bananas, oil, condiments, rice and others she uses to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 28 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres.El trabajo de Rocío consiste en la venta de cosméticos, entre los productos que vende tiene polvos faciales, lápiz labial, perfumes, colonias, shampoo, talcos y otros artículos para el cuidado de la piel y del cuerpo. Lleva realizando este negocio hace 6 años y vende sus productos principalmente entre sus amigos y familiares bajo el sistema de entrega crediticia, posteriormente realiza la cobranza. Afirma que trabaja sola ya que así sus ganancias económicas se incrementan. Por otra parte, durante las mañanas trabaja como secretaria en una institución pública, eso le permite también ofrecer sus productos entre sus compañeras de labor. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para estar a lado de su familia, le va muy bien ya que sus ganancias superan a su inversión inicial, más adelante espera establecer una tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos con mayor comodidad además de otros accesorios y prendas femeninas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, talcos y otros productos con los cuales espera incrementar sus ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Rocio is 28 years old. She is a single mother with two children, aged 12 and 9. They live at her parents' home. Rocio works selling cosmetic products such as face powder, lipstick, perfumes, colognes, shampoo, talcum powder, and other skin and body health care items. She has had this business for 6 years, selling her products mainly among friends and relatives. She sells the products on credit and gets the money later on. She works on her own because this way her income increases. She also works as a secretary at a public institution in the mornings and this allows her to also offer her products to her work colleagues. What she likes about her sales job is that it allows her to spend time with her family. She is doing very well and her income already exceeds her initial investment. In the future she is hoping to open a shop where she can offer her products in comfort as well as sell other accessories and feminine garments.
She is asking for 2000 Nuevos Soles. She is grateful for the financial support she is being offered to continue with her business. With the amount she asks for she will buy a set of cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes, talcum powder and other products with which she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase products such as perfumes, colognes, talcum powder, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump kit to be used for irrigation

loans.name: Trust

texts.en:
Trust, 48, is a farmer with two children from the farming area of Chibombo District, Zambia. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a water pump so that he can irrigate his vegetable farm.

Trust has been farming vegetables to sell at local markets for more than seven years. Currently he produces butternut squash, green peppers, and cucumbers. He has even found a buyer at a major market in the capital city who wants to purchase large quantities of watermelons. Unfortunately, without his own pump, Trust is unable to meet this demand.
 
Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Trust, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of productive equipment such as water pumps can be prohibitive, forcing many to do the labor-intensive task of watering by hand, or through occasionally hiring a pump. Once Trust secures a loan, he will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump Trust will be able to increase his production and even expand into growing different crops. The use of a pump will also mean that he can irrigate a larger portion of land in less time and not be restricted by the labor-intensive task of carrying water by hand to his field. Trust is eager to expand his production so that he can effectively supply the larger markets in Lusaka, the capital city.
 
It is for this reason Trust is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump kit that will be used for irrigation

loans.name: Leily Lizeth

texts.es: Leily, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene una hija, reside en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Hace 3 años que ella decidió por tener su propio negocio donde vende ropa como blusas, camisetas, ropa interior, pantalones, ropa de niño y sandalias. Vende desde su casa, ya tiene clientes fijos. Para aumentar su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar más ropa y sandalias para vender. Su plan es crecer con su negocio y darle un nivel de vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Leily, 22, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter.  She lives in the municipality of Puerto Cortes.  She decided three years ago to have a business of her own selling clothes like blouses, t-shirts, underwear, pants, children’s clothes and sandals.  She sells from home and has regular customers.  To increase business she’s decided to request a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy more clothes and sandals to sell.  Her plan is to grow in business and give her family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy, 43, is a farmer with eight children from the farming area of Chibombo District, Zambia. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a water pump so that he can irrigate his vegetable farm.

For the past five years Roy has been in the business of farming vegetables for the local market. Currently he produces tomatoes, onions, and butternut squash. At the moment he is unable to grow large enough quantities to meet the high demand he has for his produce (especially for onions) due to his lack of a water pump for irrigation. 
 
Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Roy, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of productive equipment such as water pumps can be prohibitive. Once Roy secures a loan, he will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Roy will be able to expand his production to meet the local demand for some of his more popular vegetables, like onions. The use of a pump will also mean that he can irrigate a larger portion of land in less time and even be able to experiment with new crops.
 
Roy added that after he obtains a water pump he would like to start growing melons, which require more water but are very popular in the region.
 
It is for this reason Roy is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump kit for irrigation

loans.name: Tiessiri  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koni, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,   région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA deuxième  personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne qui servira pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI IV" are married women averaging 44 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koni, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, DJENEBA, who is sitting second from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 100,000 francs per planting. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Kpemahuton 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEMAHUTON 5 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Tolomè Agath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tolomè Agath est âgée de 38 ans. Tolomè Agath a appris la coiffure. Tolomè Agath est mariée à un certain Médard. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Tolomè Agath vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, en plus de son activité Tolomè Agath vend des ustensiles plastiques à son domicile depuis seize ans. Tolomè Agath s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tolomè Agath sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEMAHUTON 5, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs a été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group KPEMAHUTON 5 is composed of three persons who live together. The group's representative, Tolomè Agath, is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. She is 38 years old and has learned to be a hairstylist. She is married to a man named Médard. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school. Both are in their care. Tolomè Agath lives together with her husband and children. 

The couple jointly ensure that the family expenses are covered. To do so, aside from her work, Tolomè Agath has been selling plastic utensils at her home for sixteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Tolomè Agath is requesting, along with the other member of the group KPEMAHUTON 5, a third loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Sibnkor, a section of Montserrado County, which is the capital of Liberia and its well-known commercial center. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children between the ages of 7 and 13, all of whom are enrolled in school and live at home. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling dried fish in the local community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned the trade from her mother. She works for eight hours a day and transports her produce to market by using taxis. She describes herself as business-minded, and enjoys her work because she can earn a good profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more dry fish to sell so that she can expand her sales and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to expand her sales by buying more dried fish.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where the living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the best laid out place in Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 4 months. Only two of them are in school and all three of them live at home.

She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past three years Rebecca has been running a market table where she sells frozen chicken in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM. She likes her business because of the way the customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  

Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel, de 21 años de edad, está casada con Alexander quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 2 hijos a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Raquel es la elaboración y venta de refrescos de frutas como cocona, camu camu, maracuyá, aguaje, cebada y otros. Tiene una carretilla que le permite trabajar ambulatoriamente trasladando sus baldes con refrescos por las calles de la ciudad o establecerse cerca de un centro comercial muy concurrido. Se inició hace más de 5 años, actualmente tienes 2 carretillas más en las que trabajan 2 personas a quienes a contratado para cumplir con la misma labor.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un oficio con el cual puede generar ingresos económicos para ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de frutas amazónicas en mayor volumen como camu camu, aguaje, anona y cocona para poder elaborar refrescos de diversos sabores.
texts.en:
Raquel, 21 years old, is married to Alexander, who makes his living in transportation.  He is father to her two children, whom he loves a lot.

The business that Raquel is engaged in is the production and sale of fruit drinks such as cocona, camu camu [local fruits], passion fruit, aguaje, barley and others.  She has a cart which allows her to work as a street vendor, moving her buckets of fruit drinks through the city streets, or establishing herself near a crowded shopping center.

She started more than 5 years ago.  She currently has two more carts that are worked by two people that she has hired to do the same work.  She likes her business because it allows her to have a trade with which she can generate income to help her husband cover household expenses and provide a better quality of life to their small children.

On this occasion, she is applying for loan of 500 soles.  She is very happy for the financial support provided so that she can get ahead in her work.  She will invest the requested amount in large volume purchases of Amazonian fruit, such as camu camu, aguaje, custard apple and cocona, so that she can make fruit drinks of different flavors.

loans.use: to buy regional fruits, such as aguaje and cocona, among others.

loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Koni, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOROTOUMOU première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de100 000F CFA environs par campagne qui servira pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI III" are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koni, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, okra, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, KOROTOUMOU, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will be used to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Tiessiri  V Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koni, un des villages de la commune de Marka Coungo,   région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU troisième personne au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.Ha de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Maraka Coungo, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne qui sera utilisé pour aider le mari à prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group "TIESSIRI V" are married women averaging 35 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Koni, a village in Commune de Marka Coungo, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, millet, and sesame. The group members are on their sixth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, KADIATOU, who the third person in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Marka Coungo City to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will be used to help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, weeding, and sundry equipment.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: AFEPEB est un groupe de neuf personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Albertine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Albertine âgée de 45 ans, ne vit plus avec son mari. Albertine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Albertine a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Albertine vit seule avec ses enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Albertine vend des tissus de façon ambulante depuis huit ans. Albertine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Albertine s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe AFEPEB pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AFEPEB is a group of nine persons whose members live together. The group's representative, Albertine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 45 years old and no longer lives with her husband. Albertine did not go to school. She has two children, of whom one is in school. Both are in her care. She lives alone with her children. 

To meet the needs of the family, Albertine has been selling fabrics door to door for eight years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying the demands of her customers, Albertine joined with the other member of the group AFEPEB to request a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sell door to door

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump kit for irrigation

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan citizen, aged 45 and divorced with 4 children, all attending school. Robert is a businessman who deals in produce and the cattle trade, and also grows different types of crops which work as side income for him.

He has done these businesses for the last 5 years and says his main purpose was to boost his income and take care of his children. He has purposely applied for this loan to buy a piece of land to help provide a cattle shed and a farm house for the cattle herders.  
 
He also hopes to use this loan to buy two Friesian bulls for cross breeding for better yields. This will further finance studies for his children. Robert confesses that his main challenges are dealing with cattle and livestock diseases, epidemics like foot and mouth disease, and disasters like droughts that have run for over eight months. However, he boasts of improvement in his daily life because of this business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: La Sra. Lucy  tiene 45 años,  casada con dos hijos de las edades de 18 y 13, todos ellos en edad escolar,  ella se dedica al comercio de variedad de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un congelador grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne., la Sra. Lucy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero ella tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Lucy is 45 years old. She is married and she has two children.  The children are 18 and 13 years old. Both are in school. Lucy sells a variety of meats at her butcher shop located in the Tahuantinsuyo area. This loan is her second with the institution. Lucy is going to use this loan to purchase a large freezer for keeping her products in good condition. The reason for requesting this loan is that a freezer is required for selling meat.  The challenge Lucy faces in her business is competition since there are several butchers in the area. She has a large customer base because of her friendly manner with her customers. She is going to use these benefits to purchase another large freezer. Her wish for her business is to have a stable and profitable business in order to be able to increase her earnings

loans.use: purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Xiomara Noemi

texts.es:
Xiomara es una mujer de joven de 25 años de edad con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas para su única hija la cual está en el kínder, para ella y su pareja siendo el, el único apoyo e involucrado en el cultivo de café del cual son propietarios. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado el cual curso el primer grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabar la tierra desde muy pequeña. En compañía de su pareja trabajan la tierra hace más de 10 años y las tierras que trabajan son propias gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres el cual esta ubicadas a 200 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie para dar el mantenimiento a sus cultivos mismos que son comercializados en el mercado local y con los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona.

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares para dar mantenimiento y asegurar la cosecha de café de esa forma fortalecer el grano y sanear sus cultivos en su totalidad. 
  
Su meta es hacer de sus tierras y sus cultivos los mejores de la zona para poder generar ingresos para su familia y poder cumplir su sueño y deseo el de ver a su hija convertida en una persona profesional, próspera, con mucho éxito en la vida logrando cada meta que se proponga para que sea una persona triunfadora en la vida.
texts.en:
Xiomara’s a 25-year-old woman with many dreams and hopes for her only daughter who is in Kindergarten and for her and her spouse.  He is her only support in growing a coffee crop they own.  She did not complete elementary school; she only attended first grade but was unable to go further for lack of economic support from her parents who taught her how to work the land when she was very little.  She and her spouse have worked the land for more than ten years.  The land they grow on is theirs thanks to an inheritance from their parents.  It’s located 200 meters from their house and they get to it on foot to care for their crops which are then sold in the local market and to various buyers that come to the zone.

She’s asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure and leaf fertilizer to provide crop maintenance and insure a good coffee crop; to strengthen the beans and keep her entire crop healthy. Her goal is to make her  land and her crops the best in the zone so she can generate family income and be able to reach her dream of seeing her daughter become a professional, prosperous person with much success in life reaching every goal she sets for herself to become a victorious person in life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela sigue con la actividad de la venta de comida cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos por mayor, creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos también como arroz, fideo y aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus comidas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Ángela continues with the activity of selling food.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan since she used it to buy ingredients at wholesale.  Her activity grew and so did her clientele and as a result so did her income.  On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles and oil at wholesale too to make her dishes.  She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity she’s being offered.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Saygon

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Saygon from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She completed 1st grade and is married.  describes herself as a hardworking person. Her spouse is a driver. She has five children between the ages of 15 and 28.  Two are in school and two live at home. 

Saygon has a table at the market which sells red oil, pepper, okra, etc. She has been in business for ten years and works 10 hours at her business every day. With this loan, she will buy inventory for her shop. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because helps to improve her children's lives. Her plan is to educate her children and one day own a store in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia de 45 años de edad, se dedica a al venta de mercancía (ropa, accesorios y calzado) desde hace algunos años, como fuente económica. Su familia es lo más importante para ella y el motor que la impulsa a salir adelante. La calidad de vida de sus dos hijas se ha constituido en su mayor reto, razón que la ha motivado a laborar fuertemente y brindarles una educación de calidad. 
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida. Razones que la han impulsado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
45-year-old Claudia has a business selling merchandise (clothing, accessories and footwear) which she has been running for a number of years.  It is her source of income.  Her family is the most important thing in the world to her and they motivate her to continue making progress.  Her daughters' quality of life has been her biggest challenge and this has motivated her to work hard so that she could provide them with a good education.

Claudia dreams of owning her own home and guaranteeing her family better opportunities in life.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying stock with the aim of increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories and footwear

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: FIFAME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pauline âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Bernard. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pauline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Pauline vend des boules d’akassa (fait à base de farine de maïs) et du poisson de façon ambulante depuis six ans. Pauline s'approvisionne dans au port de pêche du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Pauline s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
FIFAME is a group of three persons whose members live together. The group's representative, Pauline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 39 years old and married to a man named Bernard. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. Pauline lives with her husband and children. 

The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. To do so, Pauline has been selling 'akassa' balls (made from cornmeal) and fish on the streets for six years. She gets her supplies from a Benin fishing port. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying the demands of her customers, Pauline joined with the other member of the group FIFAME to request a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase condiments and fish to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, which is well known as the most commercial city in Liberia. Patience is 29 years old and single with two children, ages 6 and 2 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past two years Patience has been selling rice, pepper, vita, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her mother and also learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 8 hours a day with her business and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

She said that she is business minded, and likes her business because it gives her some profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sales.  Patience wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, vita, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 32 años de edad,es soltera y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de su madre junto a su hermano luchando juntos por salir adelante.Nelly se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa como polos, faldas, blusas y camisas para niños y niñas así como también prendas interiores femeninas en diversos modelos, tallas y colores que son los más solicitados por sus clientes en ciertas temporadas. Toda su mercadería lo distribuye entre sus vecinas y amistades. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 5 años y actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes gracias al trato personalizado y cordial que muestra cuando realiza sus ventas. Ocasionalmente también vende prendas usadas en los pueblos ribereños.Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cual sustenta los gastos de su hogar, se siente contenta  ya que su actividad le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos, tiene muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y ampliar la cantidad de productos de ofrece.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para comprar ropa de diversos modelos, tallas y colores.
texts.en:
Nelly, 32, is single and has no children.  She currently lives in her mother’s house with her brother; they strive together to get ahead.  Nelly works buying and selling clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses and shirts for boys and girls; she also sells women’s underwear in various styles, sizes and colors that are the most requested by her customers in certain seasons.  

She sells all her merchandise among neighbors and acquaintances.  She’s been in this business for more than five years and currently has many customers thanks to the personalized, cordial treatment she offers at the time of the sale.  She sometimes also sells used clothes in various towns along the river banks.  What she likes about this activity is that it generates income to cover household expenses.  

She feels happy because this activity has brought her much satisfaction and has gotten her out of many economic tight spots.  She very much wants to continue working and expanding the amount of products she offers.  On this occasion, she’ll ask for 1,000 soles to buy clothes in various sizes, styles and colors.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Musayam

texts.ru: Мусаям добродушная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Детям 12, 8 и 5 лет. Она имеет большой опыт в системе образования таджикского народа. Она работает в сельской школе учительницей и имеет много учеников, которые на сегодняшний день работают в различных сферах. Она гордится своими учениками. Мусаям планирует отремонтировать свой старый дом. Деньги, которые отправляет ее муж, не хватает для ремонта и ее зарплата тоже очень маленькая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Musayam is a kind-spirited woman.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  Her children are ages twelve, eight and five.  She has much experience in the Tajik education system.  She works at a rural school as a teacher and has had many students that now work in many different industries.  She is proud of them.  Musayam plans to make repairs to her old home.  The money that her husband sends to her is not enough for the renovation--neither is her own pay which is little.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy construction materials.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the best laid out place in Liberia. She is 46 years old and married with two children, ages 26 and 8, who are both in school and live at home.

For the past ten years Sarah has been selling spare ribs in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 9 hours a day with her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

She said that she is business-minded and likes her business because it gives her some profit. Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more spare ribs to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more spare ribs to expand her sales.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, de 48 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años, vive en su casa propia junto a los miembros de su familia.El trabajo de Inés, consiste principalmente en la venta de comidas. Tiene su puesto de ventas en el mercado de la ciudad y ahí ofrece diariamente los más deliciosos platillos regionales como pescados asados, chorizos, pollo y otros que caracterizan a la comida peruana. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano y culmina aproximadamente a las 3 de la tarde. Lleva realizando este negocio por 8 años con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que desarrolla una labor que le fascina desde muy pequeña, siempre cocinó y le agrada ahora ponerlo en práctica como una oportunidad de negocio, además gracias a este trabajo tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le sirven para solventar los gastos de su hogar y brindarles las comodidades necesarias a su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir avanzando con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes e insumos utilizados en la preparación de sus potajes como aceites, arroz, verduras, tubérculos, condimentos carnes y otros productos.
texts.en:
Inés, 48, is married and has a 12-year-old son.  She lives in her own house with her family members.  Her work consists primarily in selling food.  She has her stand in a market in the city and she offers delicious regional dishes like grilled fish, sausages, chicken and others that are characteristic of Peruvian cuisine there every day.  Her work starts very early and ends at about 3 in the afternoon.  She’s been in business 8 years with her husband’s unconditional support.

What she likes about her work is that she works doing what has fascinated her since she was very little; she always cooked and now she puts it into practice as a business opportunity.  In addition, this work earns good income that she can use to cover household expenses and provide comfort for her family.

On this occasion, she’ll request 3,500 soles and she’s very happy for the financial support she’ll get to continue in business.  She will use the requested amount to progressively buy all the ingredients and supplies like oil, rice, vegetables, tubers, condiments, meats and others she uses to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Binda

texts.en:
Please meet 24-year-old Binda from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distributes to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

She completed 2nd grade and is married. She describes herself as hardworking person. Her spouse is a security guard. She has a four-month-old child. 

Binda has a shop where she sells artificial hair. She has been in business for ten years and works 8 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy more inventory. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by shared taxi. She started her business with money from hr husband. She is proud of her business because it help to improve her children's lives. Her plan is to educate her children and one day own a store in the near future. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: she will buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es: Jacobo, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el municipio de Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. El lleva 9 años de dedicarse a cultivar sus propias parcelas de café y granos básicos en cantidades pequeñas para consumo y venta. La producción de café la vende en pergamino en el mercado local del municipio. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para sus cultivos, lo que le ha permitido aumentar poco a poco. La venta de su producción es la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es el sexto ciclo y lo va invertir en la compra d e fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo de café y lograr sacar buena cosecha. Su objetivo es seguir ampliando las parcelas poco a poco y poder darle a su familia lo necesario como alimentación, salud, educación y vivienda.
texts.en:
Jacobo, 36, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Nuevo Celilac, Santa Bárbara. For nine years, he has been growing coffee and basic grains in small quantities on his own land for consumption and sale. He sells his coffee crop in parchment bags at the local market. He has previously applied for several crop loans, which have allowed his business to slowly grow. Crop sales are his source of income to support his family. 

This will be his sixth loan cycle, and he will use the money to buy fertilizer to improve his coffee plantings and produce a good harvest. His goal is to slowly add more land and to give his family what it needs in terms of food, health care, education, and housing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловару 23 года. Он женат на трудолюбивой женщине, которая занимается вышиванием национальных платков. Диловар и его жена не имеют детей. Диловар более 3 лет предоставляет услуги съёмщика свадебных торжеств и других мероприятий, а также монтаж по заказу клиентов. Он имеет большой талант о достаточный опыт. Поэтому он выполняет свою работу высококачественно и имеет своих клиентов на рынке конкуренции. Диловар уже второй цикл кредитуется и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, песок, краски и т.п.  для ремонта дома, так как его дом старый и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilovar is 23 years old and is married to a hardworking woman who works making the national women's clothing of Tajikistan.  Dilovar and his wife do not have children.  For more than three years, he has worked as a cameraman for weddings and other events.  He also makes montages to order.  He is very talented and has much experience.  Because of this, his work is of high quality and he has his own clients despite much competition.  This is Dilovar's second loan and he has a positive credit history.  He is asking for a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, sand, paint, etc., to make repairs to his home since it is old and needs major renovations.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your compassion.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc.

loans.name: Wrejay

texts.en:
Wrejay lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the most commercial city in Liberia. Wrejay is 48 years old and married. Her husband is not working now. They have two children, ages 28 and 9. Only one is in school and lives at home.

For the past seven years Wrejay has been selling ed-doe (a small root vegetable related to taro), palm nuts, potatoes, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband when he was working, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends 10 hours a day with her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table.

Wrejay said that she is business minded, and likes her business because it gives her some profit. She is requesting a loan to buy more ed-doe, palm nuts, potatoes, etc. to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more ed-doe, palm nuts, potatoes, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Watchoee is 46 years old and lives Paynesville North Area, Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. She is single and has three children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Only two of them live at home and attend school. She was too unfortunate to attend school. She has been selling soft drinks in the local market for the past six years, a business she started with money given to her by her brother. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her future plan is to educate all of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
This is Tenneh from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 35, single with three children.  Her children's ages ares 9 months and 12.  They all are currently living at home and only two are in school.  
For the past seven years, Tebbeh has owned her own table  business selling fashion slippers.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase fashion slippers for her business.
